notesStmt.note: Ibrahim ibn Yusuf ibn Sa῾id ibn Ibrahim al-Israili(Hebrew version of his name in Or 2211): inscribed with his name in the colophon, Sana, 1469 (154v-155r). Yosef ben Suliman/Solomon: inscribed with his name in two purchase notes (37v). Benyamin ben Avraham: inscribed with his name in two purchase notes (37v). Avraham ben Yosef ben Sa῾id Hanatsel owner: inscribed with his name in a purchase note, Adar .. .. [year is deleted] according to the Seleucid era (38r). Sala'am ben Yosef ben Avraham: inscribed with his name in a purchase note, Adar .. .. [year is deleted] according to the Seleucid era (38r). Ha-Kohen David ben Yosef: inscribed with his name in a purchase note, Adar .. .. [year is deleted] according to the Seleucid era (38r). Yosef ben Se῾adia: inscribed with his name in a purchase note, Adar .. .. [year is deleted] according to the Seleucid era (38r). Avraham ben Yosef: inscribed with his name in a purchase note, Adar .. .. [year is deleted] according to the Seleucid era (38r). Erased inscription in Hebrew characters (154). Yudah ben Se῾adia.. ..: inscribed with his name in the margin (156v). Erased inscription with Hebrew characters (158v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Pentateuch, with masorah magna, parva, vowel-points and accents. Maḥberet ha-tigan is prefixed.

collation.p: Too tight bound to determine exact gathering structure.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, partially punctuated, of the 15th century. The scribe's name, Benayah ben Se῾adia ben Zekharyah ben Margaz, is not mentioned in the colophon. On his identification see 33.
